name: Methylphenidate Transdermal (Daytrana)
summary: A transdermal methylphenidate patch used to treat attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) in children and adolescents.
description: Daytrana is a transdermal patch formulation of methylphenidate that delivers the medication through the skin over approximately 9 hours. It is indicated for ADHD in patients aged 6–17 years. The patch offers an alternative for those who cannot tolerate or swallow oral formulations and allows flexible control of daily duration by adjusting wear time.

contraindications: Tics or family history of Tourette's syndrome
Hypersensitivity to methylphenidate or patch components

sections.text: Blocks norepinephrine and dopamine reuptake into presynaptic neurons, increasing their synaptic availability; delivered through the skin for steady absorption.

pediatric.adhd: Apply 10 mg patch once daily to hip area, worn for up to 9 hours; adjust dose by patch size (10, 15, 20, 30 mg) at weekly intervals as needed.

items: Transdermal patches: 10 mg/9 hr, 15 mg/9 hr, 20 mg/9 hr, 30 mg/9 hr

sections.text: Onset: 2 hours after application; duration: approximately 11–12 hours depending on wear time.

serious: sudden cardiac death in patients with structural heart abnormalities

sections.black_box: High potential for abuse and dependence.
other: May increase blood pressure and heart rate—monitor regularly
Chemical leukoderma reported—discontinue if skin color changes occur
Remove patch earlier in day to reduce insomnia risk

items: BP and HR at baseline and periodically

sections.pregnancy: Use if benefits outweigh risks; limited data
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; monitor infant

sections.text: Gradual dose reduction not typically required; remove patch and discontinue use. Abrupt discontinuation may cause fatigue or mood changes.

items: Apply to clean, dry skin on hip; alternate sides daily
Patch can be removed early to shorten duration of effect
Avoid heat sources over patch site to prevent increased drug absorption
